notEnoughChars: You must enter at least @chars characters!
ariaNavigatedToSolution: Navigated to newly included sample solution after textarea.
ariaShowSolution: Show the solution. You will be provided with a sample solution.
ariaRetry: Retry the task. You can improve your previous answer if the author allowed that.
taskDescription: A  person who weighs 170 pounds on Earth would weigh 64 pounds on Mars. Write this comparison as a ratio.
detailedSolution:
With <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mi>a</mi>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">a</annotation></semantics></math> = 170 pounds on Earth, and <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mi>b</mi>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">b</annotation></semantics></math> = 64 pounds on Mars, the ratio is  170 to 64; or 170:64; or <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mfrac>
    <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
      <mn>170</mn>
    </mrow>
    <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
      <mn>64</mn>
    </mrow>
  </mfrac>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">\frac{{170}}{{64}}</annotation></semantics></math>.
